Description: Stone handle (handhold or bearing block of a bow drill).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Bow drill used for drilling wood or stone, or for starting fires. Made from a smooth, hard and heavy stone with red -brown surfaces (Haematite?). Or this red could be paint. Where it is worn the stone is brown.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TI.26)
